config.do_a_barrel_roll.advanced.descrip: §lThese settings allow you to modify certain calculations used for flight, and are recommended for advanced users only.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.banking.automati: Applies an artificial roll input to reorient the camera to be right side up when it is rolled by 90 degrees or less in either direction. Enabling this together with switching the roll and yaw axes will make flight more vanilla-like, while still allowing manual rolling and loop-de-loops. You may also find this option helpful in reducing motion sickness.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.banking.enable_b: Adds a slight continuous yaw and pitch to the camera based on your current roll. Creates a more realistic, plane-like feeling while flying,  allowing you to make turns without having to do full 90 degree rolls.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.banking.simulate: Makes... an attempt to simulate the variable authority of different control surfaces based on your current angle of attack. This is experimental and subject to change in the future, but might improve your flight experience.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.banking_math.ban:
§7This expression is used to calculate the amount of absolute yaw to apply when banking is enabled.
By default, this is based on the player's current pitch and roll, and the configured banking strength.

Note: Absolute yaw in this case means the yaw that is applied as if the player's roll were zero.

Additional variables:
  - §f$§abanking_strength§7: The configured banking strength.

§7This expression is used to calculate the amount of absolute pitch to apply when banking is enabled.
By default, this is based on the player's current pitch and roll, and the configured banking strength.

Note: Absolute pitch in this case means the pitch that is applied as if the player's roll were zero.

Additional variables:
  - §f$§abanking_strength§7: The configured banking strength.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.constants_docume:
§7The following constants are available:
  - §6PI§7: The value of pi.
  - §6E§7: The value of e.
  - §6TO_RAD§7: The conversion factor from degrees to radians.
  - §6TO_DEG§7: The conversion factor from radians to degrees.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.control_surface_: §7This expression is used to calculate the efficacy of the aileron control surface. By default, this is based on the estimated angle of attack of the control surface.
§7This expression is used to calculate the efficacy of the elevator control surface. By default, this is based on the estimated angle of attack of the control surface.
§7This expression is used to calculate the efficacy of the rudder control surface. By default, this is based on the estimated angle of attack of the control surface.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controller.descr: Only applicable when Controlify is installed.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controls.activat: Configures how the Elytra is activated.

§lHybrid§r: Jumping once while off the ground activates standard vanilla flight,  jumping again after that enables the mod and unlocks the roll axis. Takes some getting used to,  but can be helpful when taking off in confined spaces.
§lHybrid Toggle§r: Same as Hybrid mode, but jumping toggles the mod and roll axis instead of just  enabling it once, essentially letting you switch the mod on and off on the fly. (pun intended)
§lTriple Jump§r: Requires you to jump twice while off the ground instead of once.  Can be helpful in preventing your elytra from activating while sprint jumping.
§lVanilla§r: Same as vanilla; jump once while off the ground.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controls.disable: Disables the mod while you are underwater.  It is recommended to keep this enabled to prevent loss of control while swimming.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controls.invert_: Inverts the pitch axis while flying with a mouse.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controls.momentu: Makes it easier to make continuous movements with the mouse,  Though it can take some getting used to.
Specify a deadzone when using the momentum based mouse.  This can make it easier to fly straight, but higher values will make subtle adjustments more difficult.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controls.show_mo: Turn the crosshair into a helpful widget when using the momentum based mouse. The length of the line indicates the amount of turning power applied in a given direction.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.controls.switch_: Switch the roll and yaw axis while using a mouse to be more in line with vanilla movement.  This is not recommended for the best experience™, but might make flying easier for some people.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.documentation.de:
§7The expressions above use a custom expression language that allows you to use variables and functions in your calculations.


For basic mathematical operations, you can use the standard operators: §d+§7, §d-§7, §d*§7, §d/§7, and §d^§7 for exponentiation.
The calculation order follows PEMDAS, so you can use parentheses to group operations.


Aside from that, there are three types of named expression you can use:
  - §f$§avariables§7: These start with a §f$§7, and hold dynamic values.
  - §efunctions§f()§7: These are names followed by parentheses, and take arguments in the parentheses.
  - §6CONSTANTS§7: These are names that are not variables or functions, and are replaced with a constant value.


Expand the categories below to see the available variables, functions, and constants.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.documentation.ge: Do you want to open this Discord invite link in your browser?
config.do_a_barrel_roll.functions_docume:
§7The following functions are available:
  - §esqrt§f(x)§7: Returns the square root of x.
  - §esin§f(x)§7: Returns the sine of x.
  - §ecos§f(x)§7: Returns the cosine of x.
  - §etan§f(x)§7: Returns the tangent of x.
  - §easin§f(x)§7: Returns the arcsine of x.
  - §eacos§f(x)§7: Returns the arccosine of x.
  - §eatan§f(x)§7: Returns the arctangent of x.
  - §eabs§f(x)§7: Returns the absolute value of x.
  - §eciel§f(x)§7: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to x.
  - §efloor§f(x)§7: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to x.
  - §eround§f(x)§7: Returns the integer closest to x.
  - §elog§f(x)§7: Returns the natural logarithm of x.
  - §erandint§f(max)§7: Returns a random integer between 0 and max.
  - §erandint§f(min, max)§7: Returns a random integer between min and max.
  - §emin§f(x, y)§7: Returns the smaller of x and y.
  - §emax§f(x, y)§7: Returns the larger of x and y.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.gameplay.allow_t: Allows players to use the forward and back keys (W and S by default)  to infinitely accelerate and decelerate respectively.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.gameplay.kinetic: Configures how the Elytra is activated.
§lHigh Speed§r: Only applies kinetic damage at significantly increased speed.
§lInsta-kill§r: Instantly kills the player when they hit a wall.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.general.mod_enab: Enables or disables the mod entirely.  Can also be toggled using %1$s ingame.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.hud.show_horizon: Show a simple artificial horizon widget around your crosshair.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.server.descripti: §lThese settings apply server-wide and can only be changed by operators.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.server.force_ena: Forces the mod to be enabled for all players on the server.  This will disable client-side toggling and some activation behaviours.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.server.force_ins: Forces the mod to be installed for all players on the server.  This will kick any players that don't have the mod loaded.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.server.installed: The amount of time in seconds that the server will  wait for a client to respond to the handshake before kicking them. §lIncrease this if players with bad connections are getting kicked even though they have the mod installed.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.thrust.enable_th:
Enables you to use the %1$s key to infinitely accelerate while flying with an Elytra.
§4This feature is disabled on any server that does not explicitly allow it.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.thrust.max_thrus: The maximum speed that can be reached by thrusting in blocks per tick.  Setting this to anything above 2-3 might cause problems with chunks not loading fast enough.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.thrust.thrust_ac: The acceleration of thrusting in blocks per tick squared.  Higher values will make it easier to reach max speed.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.title: §lDo a Barrel Roll
config.do_a_barrel_roll.variables_docume:
§7The following variables are available:
  - §f$§apitch§7: The player's current pitch, in degrees.
  - §f$§ayaw§7: The player's current yaw, in degrees.
  - §f$§aroll§7: The player's current roll, in degrees.
  - §f$§avelocity_length§7: The player's current velocity, in blocks per tick.
  - §f$§avelocity_x§7: The player's current velocity along the X axis, in blocks per tick.
  - §f$§avelocity_y§7: The player's current velocity along the Y axis, in blocks per tick.
  - §f$§avelocity_z§7: The player's current velocity along the Z axis, in blocks per tick.
  - §f$§alook_x§7: The player's current look vector along the X axis.
  - §f$§alook_y§7: The player's current look vector along the Y axis.
  - §f$§alook_z§7: The player's current look vector along the Z axis.
config.do_a_barrel_roll.yacl.missing: Yet Another Config Lib is not installed
config.do_a_barrel_roll.yacl.missing.mes: YACL 3 is required to edit the config in game, would you like to install YACL 3?
config.do_a_barrel_roll.yacl.outdated: Yet Another Config Lib is outdated
config.do_a_barrel_roll.yacl.outdated.me: The latest version of YACL 3 is required to edit the config in game, would you like to update YACL 3?
key.do_a_barrel_roll.toggle_enabled.disa: §cYou cannot disable Do a Barrel Roll on this server
key.do_a_barrel_roll.toggle_thrust.disal: §cYou cannot use thrusting on this server
toast.do_a_barrel_roll.mod_forced_enable: This mod is forcibly enabled by this server,  client-side toggling and some activation behaviours will be disabled.
toast.do_a_barrel_roll.server_config_upd: Failed to update server config, please check the server logs for more information.
Server config updated successfully, sending new config to all players.
toast.do_a_barrel_roll.thrusting_disable: §cElytra thrusting is not allowed on this server, the feature will be forcibly disabled.  Disable it in your client config to remove this message.
